website_summaries.verdict: Made from 100% recycled paper for a soft bedding that pets will love.
pros: This is a straightforward, fluffy bedding that is chemical-free and unbleached to keep your pets safe
Light in weight and moderately absorbent
For the price, a large volume of bedding is included
cons: Not entirely dust-free, though it is less dusty than most of the competition

customer_reviews.title: OMG no more odor
customer_reviews.text: We have a rabbit, and my daughter has been cleaning the cage at LEAST once a week. The way rabbits poop, we could be cleaning the cage every day and it still would be dirty. Although I have been using a recycled paper bedding, I purchased this to see if it would help with the ammonia order. It’s a miracle! I don’t even smell the rabbit who lives in our living room by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Healy

customer_reviews.title: Dust Bowl
customer_reviews.text: Product comes as photographed. I had to find a storage container for the bedding because the seal lock doesn't work after opening (no, I did not damage it when I cut the bag open). There is a lot of dust! I was very glad that I was not wearing my contacts when I poured this bag into a container. My glasses were completely covered in dust and my black dress became very gray. i had to take an allergy pill after pouring bedding into container, as I could not stop sneezing. The air became a dust cloud. The bedding is soft and crumbles apart easy.
customer_reviews.author: Always Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bedding I’ve found to help with odor for our guinea pigs we can go 5-7 days with no smell at all
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this bedding!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a litter trained rabbit in my daughters bedroom so odor control is a must. This is the best litter by far for odor control! I only have to change the pan once a week (lined with 3 inches of newspaper on the bottom and topped with 2 inches of bedding) cannot recommend this enough!!
customer_reviews.author: PAsFab5

customer_reviews.title: Soft, dry and easy to clean for bird's nestbox
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cockatiels nest box, it works great ... the babies were dry all the time and no bad smell plus it was a lot softer than other bedding. It has a weird smell, not bad, but since I don't know if the babies are sensitive to Smells I left the back door open so that smell goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: The bees knees bedding!
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple guineas for the last several years and change litter frequently. I have tried all the methods. This is really tge bees knees of bedding material. I find it keeps the odor down, keeps the pets dry, creates the least amounr of dust or scatter, BUT it's also a little more on the expensive side. I usually use it in combination with another type of bedding that is cheaper to hopefully cut down on cost, but also reap the benefits of both types.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Guniea Pog Approved. Way, way, way  better than the "3x expanding" competitor product
customer_reviews.text: So I've used Kaytee bedding for a couple of years but saw that the local let store was using this. Thought, let's give it a try. I love it! Heres why... 1. The smell is 10x better than the other brand. 2. It's way easier to sweep the cage floor as it does that thrown everywhere. We have a pretty big cage (2.5' by 6') 3. Color is gray, color stays gray. Not like color is white...Color is now not white. You might go through a wee but more bedding, but it's so much cleaner and keeps the smell way way down. That's the important part.
customer_reviews.author: R. Forbes

customer_reviews.title: and it works great for less cost
customer_reviews.text: I was using Fresh News small animal paper litter, but it didn't really contain the urine odor from my unaltered male rabbit even with changing the litter pan each day. I switched to the Fresh World Bedding, and it works great for less cost. Odor is much less, and my rabbit seems to like nibbling on it more. He also doesn't dump his litter pan nearly as much.
customer_reviews.author: C. Merrell

customer_reviews.title: Dust cloud
customer_reviews.text: Highly absorbent bedding and it even looked good in the cage. However, after a few days of having it in there, I noticed that all of my hedgehog’s hides were getting covered in a dark gray dust. I’d stick to this product forever if it wasn’t so dusty. However, seeing all the dust that caked up within the cage, I can’t even imagine what this stuff is capable of doing to a small pet’s lungs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Preferred bedding
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of animals, and as such, go through a lot of animal bedding. I really prefer this bedding to anything else on the market, and we have tried a lot of things... I find that it does last a good period of time, and that it helps the cages stay fresher longer. I wish it was on sale more often as sometimes you can get better deals at the brick and mortar stores, but this product is one that we will keep using as long as we have animals.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: THE DUSTIEST OF THE DUSTY
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how they are marketing this, but it is the dustiest bedding I have used. It's about the same level as cheap pine shavings. It's extremely dusty, has an odd smell, and didn't do much to control mouse or rat odors. I would not buy it again. Seriously, it's so dusty that even moving it around causes a planet Arrakis-level dust storm. Skip it and buy Feline Pine pellets or Kaytee aspen shavings.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D'Agostino

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Tried So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely detest the smell of rodent waste, and I clean my guinea pig cage once per week. The previous brand simply wasn't cutting it, as the smell would return after only a few days. I have reached Day 7 now with this brand and still no smell. Never going back... this stuff costs the same price and works at least twice as well :)
customer_reviews.author: HP Lovecraft

customer_reviews.title: Dusty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my small animals (hamster, mouse and gerbil), but I did find it to be more dusty then I wanted. I am using it for their travel cages because they do not spend too much time in them but I won't use it in their regular cage. I prefer Carefresh or Kaytee clean and cozy paper bedding which are not dusty at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paigelee

customer_reviews.title: Pass...
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this litter. I thought it would be like the pellets I had previously ordered butbit isn't. It's lose pieces of paper and they get all in my ferrets cage does not stay clean! They do NOT hold up with smell of ammonia. I will not purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many beddings in the past and this is the only one that really works. I put a layer of this under the paper bedding in my guinea pig cage and I have had absolutely no smell. It also makes clean up easy because of the way it absorbs, there is no wet mushy pile. Even in times when I have had to leave the cage longer then I would want to, it still had no smell. Will always use this product in my cages.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more soggy messes!
customer_reviews.text: This is good litter. I've tried lots of them and this seems to be the most absorbent, and doesn't act like soggy newspaper in the bottom of your litter pan. Yes, its more expensive, but I've found a way to use it that is actually less expensive: I use this style in the litter pan itself, and the regular paper bedding for them to lay on in the other areas of my rabbit hutches and indoor cages. By combining both I'm pretty sure I'm actually spending less $$!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Good for a week, definitely not 14 days.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using an odor control bedding so I have no other reference to go on. I have 2 smaller sized rabbits and typically clean out their pen every 3 days. With this I might be able to tolerate going 5 days. The bag is bag and heavy and seems like I could get about 5-6 weeks out of it. That is going sparingly with the material. It has a granular pellet texture and has no odor of its own. I’ll stick with this stuff since it does help control the urine smell.
customer_reviews.author: Greener

customer_reviews.title: helps with smell
customer_reviews.text: This bedding does help to control the smell in our guinea pig and rabbit cages. I used to have to change their cage ever couple of days, due to smell. Now, I can go at least 5 days. The animals don't seem to mind it either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much less mess.... bedding stays where it’s supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several brands of paper bedding for my guinea pig’s litter box area, everyone of them ended up all over the cage within an hour, except this bedding. Unless they purposely push it out of the litter box area (which only happens if they are startled by something and it scatters when they jump), it stays where it’s supposed to! It is also super absorbent, and smell. The bag says it controls odors for 14 days.... I don’t know about that, but I’d also never leave the same bedding for anywhere close to that long.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great product- no smell, no mess, no divorce!
customer_reviews.text: Got a bunny and was concerned about the “scent” of two little boxes in my living room. My husband was appalled 😮 and convinced nothing could hide the smell. Well I am super pleased to say this extra absorbing bedding holds up to my end of our bargain. No smell even after several uses. Low dust when changing it out and adding more to clean box. Bunny doesn’t eat it and there’s no mess! It clumps and stays IN the litter box snd is not tracked around!
customer_reviews.author: Sdstrachan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that has a pet rabbit knows their urine is horrid smelling and very strong. I have tried several brands that boast scent reduction and this is the only one that has done so well. I had been using another brand that was granular and mixed with lavender, it did ok, but nothing like this one. I would definitely recommend this to people that have pets in the house that use bedding and litter!
customer_reviews.author: SerenityRedd

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bunny litter
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter for my two bunnies. I use it to line the bottoms of their cages and then cover it with hay, and I do the same in their outside litter box. If holds in the pee smell very well and doesn't have any chemical/scented odor. And they don't try to eat it, like I've seen them do with other bedding. My only complaint would be that it's dusty, so stand back when you're pouring it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency and odor control
customer_reviews.text: This bedding has proven to last the longest when it comes to absorbency, and odor control. I have 2 rats, and the Vitakraft bedding lasts for about a week and a half, before it needs to be changed. The only dislike I have is the amount of dust it makes. But due to the nature of the bedding, I can see why it produces the amount of dust that it does.
customer_reviews.author: Samurai

customer_reviews.title: Finally!  A bedding that doesn’t stink
customer_reviews.text: I have tried at least five other types of beddings (many I’ve reviewed) as well as sprays and even likely toxic scents to get rid of the smell of my two mice. This is the FIRSR stuff I’ve found that actually keeps the odor under control. I only have to change the bedding weekly as opposed to binightly. I love it and am so glad to finally have something that works. Plus, you get a lot of bedding for the price! It lasts so much longer than the other compressed stuff.
customer_reviews.author: KGoldTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased bedding from a local store and our hamsters cage reeked for the entire time we used that bedding. My husband went hunting for a bedding that would help with the smell and also offered a good quality product. Our hamster cage is SMELL FREE and I’m beyond happy with the product! I will be a return customer on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic (if magic could get rid of smell)!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I was using Kaytee super odor whatever because reviews said it was the best at controlling smell but I would wake up and smell my bunny’s urine smell! I had to remove the wet stuff every day. WTH! I tried Vitakraft on a fluke and this stuff works! I tested how long I could go without changing the little and for my stinky bunny it’s 5 days. After that I could smell it a little.
customer_reviews.author: Mago

customer_reviews.title: Plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, but the second time I bought it, I found lots of small pieces of plastic mixed into the bedding! My rabbits eat a bit of the bedding sometimes and i’m worried they can ingest these small, sharp pieces. I barely sifted through and found 8 pieces of plastic right away. Who knows how much is in the whole bag?
customer_reviews.author: Dee Yang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bedding!!! Its not flaky or shredded paper like the other brands. Its little paper pellets that are still soft. The guinea pigs love it. Its super absorbent, no strong smell. Seems to last longer between changing. Bonus that my guinea pigs don't track it everywhere! I've been searching for this for months. Just set up subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: Russell & Emily

customer_reviews.title: 99.5% Dusty
customer_reviews.text: I think they made a typo on the “99.5% dust free” claim. Just opening the bag made me want to wear a mask. I tried it anyway thinking maybe the dust would settle... nope. I probably used it in my rabbits litter box twice. He wouldn’t even stand on it! He’d move most of his hay to cover the litter up and if he couldn’t cover it completely he’d just stand outside the litter box to eat his hay. Cleaning it out left visible dust on the paper towels I wiped the box with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bedding. It doesn’t smell, & I generally am able to spot scoop out the soiled bedding (my chinchilla tends to use the same spot) and scoot the older clean bedding into its place, then refill the empty spot w fresh. I of course periodically change all of it out. My mother was even in town visiting & she isn’t an animal fan and has an extremely sensitive nose. Never once did she mention an odor (& she would have!! 😂). I only have 1 chinchilla, so perhaps results could be different with a second, but as long as you get the soiled spots out, I don’t anticipate a problem. Oh, & bonus, it’s compostable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this for my sons bunny
customer_reviews.text: I like this bedding because it’s easy to clean and absorbs really well. We use a layer of newspaper in the litter box then put this bedding on top. I give it 4 out of 5 stars just because it doesn’t completely control the pee odor more than a few days before I need to change it again. It is better than other litters we have tried though!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy K

customer_reviews.title: Great bedding!
customer_reviews.text: Great bedding! I switched to a version with denser paper pellets, since I use it for a rabbit litter box, which requires higher absorbency since the mess is concentrated to a small area. This kind would be ideal for use as bedding! It is nice and soft, and I had no issues with odor.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best absorbency around
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Same as the pet stores but so much cheaper. And you can get on automatic shipment which helps extremely with my busy schedule. We have 3 Guinea pigs and 2 bags Monthly is what we go through. Best absorbency that I have found in any of the bedding that I have Tried. You would never know we have Three Guinea pigs in our House.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: More Mess!
customer_reviews.text: I expected a product that would help reduce the odor from my guinea pig's cage. Its not any better than a normal guinea pig bedding. The pieces are smaller, so it creates a bigger mess. Whenever the guinea pig got excited, it flew everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but way too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I've never found anything that immediately removes smell, even when just sprinkled over existing bedding. This stuff is magical...but WAY too expensive to use regularly. We go through one bag of this in one cage change (three large guinea pig cages) so it's not economical in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: Widdlewatt

customer_reviews.title: SO dusty....
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe this product advertises 99.5% dust free. It is incredibly dusty. It made me cough just pouring it into a bin . I would not recommend this product to anyone with small animals with sensitive respiratory systems. Absolute false advertising
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Best bedding I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: This stuff seems to control odor longer than the others I’ve tried. I have two rats and can go over a week without needing to change. They do make a bit of a mess of it by spilling it outside their cage. But the trade-off for the better odor control is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs it all!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly this stuff truly absorbs! I am able to dump my bunnies litter pan about once a week maybe a week and a half with little to no smell. The pan is dry and clean because it absorbs it all. Only issue is my long haired bunny 🐇 now has litter in is fur
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Best odor elimination, very little dust, no clumps. Best bedding by far.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hamster bedding we have used, by far. Almost no dust, highly absorbent and very efficient at eliminating smells for a long time ! And it doesn't stick and form clumps, preventing hamster from blocking the tubes in our Lixit Hamster Heaven.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Best rabbit bedding ever
customer_reviews.text: Best rabbit bedding there is for litter boxes. Contains smell, super absorbent. I’ve tried so many brands, and this is by far the best. It’s easy to clean, safe for rabbits, and isn’t a mess. If you sometimes have to go a bit longer between cage cleans than you’d like, this is the only bedding that can handle it. Wish it was a little cheaper, but all others pale in comparison to this.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I like this bedding, but it doesn't have the amount of odor control I was hoping for. It's better than the plain shavings type bedding, but can smell the urine after 1-2 days after cleaning the cage. We only have one tiny mouse.
customer_reviews.author: CNH

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand and I paid less for more!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I found this big bag of bedding! I purchased a smaller bag of this bedding (The same brand and features) from the pet store and paid $20 for it, which is the same price I paid for this large bag. I have had no issues with the bedding and my Hamster loves to move it around his Cage. This bedding isnt the cheap crap you sometimes get at the pet store and its worth the price! Its soft feeling and easy to sweep up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've tried various beddings that already smell terrible by the next day
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY bedding that actually works and I've tried a lot of different ones. I use this bedding for all of my small animals and you will not smell anything for well over 1 1/2 weeks. I've tried various beddings that already smell terrible by the next day. This bedding works miracles and I will never use a different bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Omg I bought a bunny for my daughter and his pee was so strong and this completely takes away that smell
customer_reviews.author: Ilovebling

customer_reviews.title: Stays dry!
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs are diabetic and urinate frequently. This is the only bedding that keeps their cage dry for a whole week. I also get more uses out of each bag than a typical 60L bag of any other type/brand.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good for guinea pig
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than regular paper bedding. I don't know why but it doesn't smell anywhere as bad as the fluffy paper even the one is supposed to have the best odor Control. We use it for a guinea pig.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last up to 14 days. . .
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of this product. Isn't messy and rabbit took right to it. However, it doesn't at all last for 14 days, not even a week based on our experience. I will be trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barclift

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency.  Lasts long. My guniea pigs love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! Use it for our 2 guinea pigs and before this product we used the wood chips and theybwere just gross. This product is great . Keeps the smell away. It lasts a week and no smelly odor. Best product and for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: This is the bedding you want
customer_reviews.text: We have two mice and the previous bedding material we used would last about 4-5 days before it started to stink but after switching to this we can easily go a couple weeks before even a hint of a smell. I did change their food from a homogeneous pellet type to the more natural chex mix style at the same time however so that may have contributed to their reduced odor. Either way i have nothing negative to say about this product. Good value as far as material included as well. One bag is lasting us about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ac

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use
customer_reviews.text: Killed my hamster within a week. Woke up Christmas morning to her having passed away. This is the first time I used this. I believe this product killed her. She was fine with the normal bedding, then I switched. Not real happy
customer_reviews.author: LoveWeeFFolkTop Contributor: Origami

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cover odor very well
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Sunseed Fresh World Heavy Duty Bedding for many years and decided to give this a try because it is a little cheaper. It's essentially the same thing, however, I don't believe it covers rabbit urine odor as well. I can clean the litter box and as soon as my rabbit uses it, I feel like I need to change it again because it smells bad. I'm going back to Sunseed because I don't like my house smelling like pets.
customer_reviews.author: mercedes83

customer_reviews.title: No more stinky hamster cage!
customer_reviews.text: Great! You can’t smell our hamsters cage an hour after you clean it anymore! It absorbs well and does not smell. There is no perfume on the bedding, so it’s not that it’s covering up odor, it just had none. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: SSSNES

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money. Great job absorbing and very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Wow a lot for your money and very easy to clean up after my bunny. I like that it doesn’t have a very strong scent to it like other products and it does a great job absorbing. It has lasted a lot longer then other products I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I did some research and this product came highly recommended but it was not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: House smells less like a pigsty!
customer_reviews.text: Great bedding, reduces odor associated with guinea pigs... wish it worked on the other pigs living with me, but I’m solving one problem at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Olichka

customer_reviews.title: Dusty as Heck
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my ferret enclosure. I change her bedding once a week and I just cleaned it today. She sneezed quite a few times when being her cage, and this stuff didn't seem dusty at first. When I was cleaning up the cage, however, there was so much dust. It took my 15 minutes just to get it off of the bottom level of the cage. I wish I could get my money back, because I will certainly not be using the rest of it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite bedding. The shipping takes a while but it worth it. Other beddings stink up really fast but this one do the job and I don't need to change it as often.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Best litter for bunnies
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stuff I have used. It doesn’t stink and it absorbs really well. I just wish it was biodegradable. I would just put it out as mulch. But the package says not to.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Will keep using again and again
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our hedgehog. It is nice and comfy for the hedgehog and easy to clean out when needed. It can get a little messy, but that's easily remedied by being a bit more careful.
customer_reviews.author: JSCluff

customer_reviews.title: Good bedding
customer_reviews.text: Works well in our rabbit cage, but is very light so she can fling it around if she starts hopping a lot. But the bag is huge and will last us more than one change. It doesn’t seem to be scented, which is good, but does seem to be holding in the rabbit smells.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It's actually pretty dusty
customer_reviews.text: If this is 95% dust free, then I'd hate to see what it was before they removed 95% of the dust. It would have had to have been more dust than granules. Still on first use so can't speak to the rest yet. Have a feeling I won't be buying again if I can avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: Soshan

customer_reviews.title: Great odor control
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this litter for my rabbit's litterbox. I honestly only bought this because the kind I have used for years wasn't available on prime for some reason so I ordered this on a whim. Now this is my new favorite litter - it controls odor better than any littler I've used before! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found for Ferrets.
customer_reviews.text: Great for scooping out of a corner litter pan for my ferrets. Nothing that I have found works as good without the dust of a litter (like cat litter). If you have a ferret this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a good litter for my bunnies for months, and this is honestly the best stuff that I have used so far. It's fluffy, dust-free, lightweight, and so far it's keeping any urine smells at bay. Love this stuff. Will be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Mulvi90

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bedding....
customer_reviews.text: The best bedding for hedgehogs...their little feet can’t handle large chunks of paper bedding...this one is perfect. We also use for the guinea pigs and bunny.....but for hedgehogs it’s the best!
customer_reviews.author: jackie boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: There's plenty in the bag but there's no scent to repel odors which makes me have to clean the cage much more often than the other brand I normally purchase
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLovely76

customer_reviews.title: Huge bag
customer_reviews.text: Bunnies started eating it! Lol... Also they track alot and gets all over the place. I do feel it helps with the amonia smell though. And the bag is huge!
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It really doesn't last as long as they say. My hamster did not like it as much as the paper. He couldn't build his little mountains with it.
customer_reviews.author: ClareKO

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the smell away
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than shredded paper. I use this and mix it with shredded paper because my hamster likes the paper to hide in. This def keeps the order under control better than anything else I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Bunny absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.text: My bunny was sleeping on it! At first we thought that she was dead because she didn't reply when we call her, but the we saw her kind of wiggling, that's when we know she's deep sleeping and so comfortable! This is definitely better than the one I bought before. Recommended for bunnies
customer_reviews.author: soursourii

customer_reviews.title: Really Good!
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews on this and gave it a try. I have to ferrets so the smell is not as bad as it used to be, it absorbs really good and stays fresh longer.
customer_reviews.author: Gnz Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great litter! I use it for my rabbit, and put a layer of paper bedding and Aspen over the top, and it works great. Controls the odor fabulously.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: this works the best. I would only say that it is dusty
customer_reviews.text: I use this bedding for my bunny and it works quite well. Have tried many other brands and so far, this works the best. I would only say that it is dusty, just not as dusty as other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Skill

customer_reviews.title: Far better then wood chips
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bedding I have used. There is little to no dust, absorbs and controls odor. My little critter seems to perfer this bedding.
customer_reviews.author: MrGreentree

customer_reviews.title: Great for guinea litter pan
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent. We have used this for guineas and our praire dog to dig in. Guineas can go a week b4 I need to change.
customer_reviews.author: MKD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect litter for rats
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter for my rats litter boxes, it doesn't smell, is highly absorbent, and contains no harmful ingredients (as many cat litters do) for when my ratties inevitably decide to taste it. Just bought my second bag and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie145

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works better than any bedding we have tried, the most we would get out of others is 3-5 days before having to chance it again, with this we are able to go almost 2 weeks! We have guinea pigs.
customer_reviews.author: Stamper

customer_reviews.title: Best!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this bedding for all types of rodents and it is the best! It lasts a long time and keeps the gross smells away.
customer_reviews.author: momma.g.of.3

customer_reviews.title: Great absorption, clean
customer_reviews.text: So far this appears to be working well for our bunny's bedding. She tends to urinate in one spot, so the bedding seems to be absorbing this well. Pros: Great absorption, clean, not dusty. Cons: May not completely mask odors but seems to do a relatively good job.
customer_reviews.author: Sashasmom1

customer_reviews.title: Odor Control
customer_reviews.text: The odor control is 100/100. One time I just couldn't clean my bunnies cage for a little bit over a week. When I went to clean her litter pan the smell was in control and her pee was 100% observed into the paper. I've been buying this product for almost 2 years now and I couldn't be more happy with it. It really does a great job and it lasts me about 3 in a half months.
customer_reviews.author: Analyss Robles

customer_reviews.title: Good bedding
customer_reviews.text: This is good bedding and the bag is a nice big size. I personally felt like it masked the scent a lot better than other brands
customer_reviews.author: HouseGriffith

customer_reviews.title: It lasts a long time and absorbs great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! I buy this bag and it lasts me FOREVER! Rabbits urine is very strong and this does the job. It absorbs it well and you don’t smell it for several days. I get more days out of it than the other kinds I’ve tried. Worth the money for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great this brand have  tried many
customer_reviews.text: Like the color, absorbency, that it has very little fly away with movement of the animals and no odor noted.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this bedding is dust free, and lasts quite a while. I can not notice any smell of urine or feces, as its been almost a month since the last cage change. I have purchased an extra bag so that I don't run out. You can get at least 4-5 cage changes from this bag..
customer_reviews.author: Jan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Oder Control!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried multiple bedding types and brands for my hedgehog and this one is by far the best! It soaks up the odor so well!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Too dusty.
customer_reviews.text: After use, when cleaning the cage there’s a lot of dust. Not good for my chinchillas or for me!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great for helping with smells
customer_reviews.text: Great product for our hamster cage we mixed this with another to have it last about 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Sloss

customer_reviews.title: Best bedding so far
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Guinea pigs and 1 hamster. I have tried many different beddings and so far this one is the best with eliminating odors. Worth the extra money, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: jwmember

customer_reviews.title: Bun approved
customer_reviews.text: Got this to try for my bunnies. And it worked good, size of bag perfect for 2 large cages. One of my bunnies was very happy with it rolling all over in it. And it lasted about 12 days before we noticed the funk...time to change Works good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Then the smell becomes pretty apparent. I find this works better for 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: This product does work for about 2 weeks. Then the smell becomes pretty apparent. I find this works better for 2 or more animals than just regular fluff like bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Isley-Salazar

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way with this stuff I was happy
customer_reviews.text: Great texture and comfort for animals it’s nice and cushy. Absorbs moisture fairly well. Last 2 weeks in between cage cleanings and I have a Flemish Giant rabbit. Their honestly isn’t really a smell that I’ve noticed but my rabbits house it’s outside so there is more constant fresh air flow out there. Over all that bedding and a great product
customer_reviews.author: Luis Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: The amount of the new bags
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter and have been using for a long time, then the bags changed and there is less litter in new bags as was the larger bags , i know this because i could overflow my tub i fill with it when i buy it, and now it doesn't even hit the top . I would rate five stars but im still paying the same price for this large bag as i was other and there is less in these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria w handy

customer_reviews.title: Good odor control
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The best I have found for odor prevention. It does tend to stick to my bunnys paws and is a bit messy, but still well worth it. I wish it would come in other colors...just saying....
customer_reviews.author: grandpianogirl

customer_reviews.title: My favorite type of bedding for my rabbit
customer_reviews.text: I never use anything else! It is the best and the only one that doesn’t make me sneeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jami Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Paper bedding crumbs for the Birds!
customer_reviews.text: I use the paper crumbles for the bottom of my bird habitats. The Bird droppings are less visible and creates the illusion of less mass. The price is right for the amount you get
customer_reviews.author: Sillykats

customer_reviews.title: Okay litter, good amount for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For a rabbit it’s just ok. You get a lot of bedding for the price but it gets saturated with liquid and compacts. Decent odor control but not the best. It also tracks with the animal out side the litter box. Would probably be great for smaller animals.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lister

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with the amount you get in the bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand! And the size of the bag! Woah! I won’t have to buy for a long while!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Helps with odor
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best types of litter have found for our guinea pig.
customer_reviews.author: Smiling is my favorite

customer_reviews.title: Dusty
customer_reviews.text: I just dumped my bag into the container and it is all dusty and it says 99.5% dust free???
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Hope more comes in stock
customer_reviews.text: Sad to see this item has been sold out for some time now. Great value and product
customer_reviews.author: Robin

product_meta.title: Vitakraft Fresh World Strength Crumble Bedding for Small Animals
product_meta.description: Size:2130 cu inSpread 2 to 3 inches of fresh world bedding on the bottom of your pet’s cage or litter box. With regular spot cleaning, The ultra strength formula can control odor for up to 14 days for most pets. Change bedding when wet, or once the odor blocker is no longer effectively controlling odors.
feature_bullets: Up to 14 days* of superior odor control

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
